data.title: Suckling wins Scottish Fuels work
data.meta_description: Suckling Transport has won a contract to distribute fuel from the Grangemouth terminal for Scottish Fuels. The agreement - initially on a short-term basis - is set to be reviewed at the end of March. A total of three vehicles on the Suckling TankShare scheme are being used to carry out the work.
data.text:
Suckling Transport has won a contract to distribute fuel from the Grangemouth terminal for Scottish Fuels.

The agreement - initially on a short-term basis - is set to be reviewed at the end of March.

A total of three vehicles on the Suckling TankShare scheme are being used to carry out the work.

Last month, Suckling reported a Â£343,376 loss for the year to March 2009, which it attributed largely to investment in new trucks and staff training.

The firm says it has returned to profit over the past six months.

Last July, Suckling signed a new distribution contract with oil giant Shell, lasting until 2014.
